precarious_papers.pipelines.data_engineering package¶

Example code for the nodes in the example pipeline. This code is meant just for illustrating basic Kedro features.

PLEASE DELETE THIS FILE ONCE YOU START WORKING ON YOUR OWN PROJECT!

Submodules¶

precarious_papers.pipelines.data_engineering.nodes.get_basis(matched, indices, price, balancesheet, income, centrality, distances, release)[source]¶

Constructs the Basis matrix and pairwise distance matrix for our experiments

Parameters:
  • matched (pd.DataFrame) – Matched graph nodes and listed companies
  • indices (pd.DataFrame) – Firm indices
  • price (pd.DataFrame) – Firm price over event window
  • balancesheet (pd.DataFrame) – firm balancesheet
  • income (pd.DataFrame) – Firm income statement
  • centrality (pd.DataFrame) – Firm global graph centrality
  • distances (pd.DataFrame) – shortest-path distance matrix
  • release (str) – Date of Paradise Papers release
Returns:

Firm characteristics, subsetting pairwise shortest-path distance matrix and returns
Return type:

Tuple[pd.DataFrame]
